intro: Sporobolus mayumbensis, commonly known as the Mayumbensis spikerush, is a perennial grass species native to the wetlands of Central and South America. It is characterized by its dense, cylindrical inflorescence and fibrous rhizomes that help it thrive in waterlogged soils. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spikelet-like flowers that are adapted for wind pollination. It plays an important ecological role in stabilizing wetland habitats and providing habitat for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes used in ecological restoration projects.
